name: start_motion_thread
description: Creates and starts a background motion thread for a specific serial port. The thread reads commands from a JSON file and sends them to the hardware. It is managed in a global registry to prevent duplicates. Returns a status string indicating success or if a thread is already running.

serial_port.description: The serial device path for communicating with the robots, used as a unique identifier for the thread. Example: '/dev/ttyACM0' or 'COM3'.

baud_rate.description: The baud rate for the serial communication. Example: 115200.

command_file.description: The path to the JSON file from which robot commands are read. Defaults to 'Data/command.json'.

name: stop_motion_thread
description: Signals the motion thread associated with a specific serial port to stop cleanly. Returns a status string indicating the result.

serial_port.description: The serial port identifier of the motion thread that should be stopped.

join_timeout.description: Seconds to wait for the thread to join after signaling stop. Defaults to 5.0.
